page.title: 19HOW THINGS HAVE CHANGED
page.content: Many things have changed in 60 years. Small mining villages wre slow to emerge into the 20th century.In 1925 earth closets,oil lamps,candles,coal for heating and cooking,no running water and unlit streets were all normal.Life was hard mining provided the only jobs and every day men walked the three miles to work.The only other transport in Hesleden was the railway now gone.The pits brought electricity to the area but the current was'nt strong enough for cookers and washers. War brought great changes for women who had done war work were reluctant to go back to household tasks and so they took jobs.This meant more labour saving devices were gave more money to the community and Nationalisation gave more money to the community and made possible holidays, television and th car.
